name: Seronera Wildlife Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Seronera Wildlife Lodge in July 2012. It is a very attractive hotel, built into boulders on the plain. It has a wonderful pool made to look like a rock pool with a waterfall. The views from the deck above the pool are stunning, with vistas around two sides of the lodge and over a waterhole, so you can watch hippos, herds of antelope, elephants, zebras, warthogs, monkeys and baboons all from the deck. The bar/lounge area is decorated with rock art murals and the walls are actually rocks. The food was good, but the service a bit over attentive. Musicians played traditional African music in the restaurant when we were there. At breakfast, we had a wonderful view from the restaurant of hot air balloons over the Serengeti at dawn. Little rock hyrax swarm all over the gardens and rock features.
reviews.title: Attractive hotel in a fabulous location
Stunning location
reviews.text: Built into a large kopje rock this has stunning 360 degree panoramic views. An excellent base for game drives - we stayed two nights and did a morning and evening drive during which we saw an amazing range of animals. The buffet was delicious with a lot of choice. Disappointed there was no souvenir shop, as had been advertised and it was irritating that the drinks had to be paid for in cash - would have been much easier to put on credit card. We took US dollars but ended a bit worried about how much we had because every time we had drinks with meals we needed some. This was the case in all lodges we went to though. Hot water was rather limited and shower pressure was rather feeble - but then again you are in the middle of the Serengeti! Amazing setting - wildlife right outside your window!

Our tour company booked our stay here, so we didn't really have a choice. Plus, there's not too many choices in the Serengeti. This lodge was in a great location, the grounds are attractive. So, what was wrong? Well, first of all, the grounds are infested with hyraxes. They were up on the roof scratching, on the walkways pooping. After awhile, they weren't cute. The swimming pool had a weird green tinge and I wouldn't let my children swim in it. There was little to no warm water. I think the worst part is that they advertise that they have an Internet cafe, fitness room, spa, boutique. There are "rooms" for all of those, but they're EMPTY except for the fitness center which is stocked with treadmills which weren't even plugged in. The buffet was typical of large lodges; bland with recycled food choices. For the price, I can't recommend this lodge.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: Built around a granite kopje, this place is an experience in itself. We used the hotel as base for safari, and its central location in Serengeti allowed a pre-breakfast safari which was our greatest few hours. We went on several expeditions, and was able to get back for the excellent food served at breakfast, lunch and dinner.
reviews.title: Nice place, an experience just to stay there
Most unique lodging!
reviews.text: The rooms are of a bit variable quality, with noisy wooden floors as the biggest problem. Go for a room on the second floor.

A old lodge in a great location. The location is right in the center of Serengeti and its a great place. The hotel though is old and it shows off. The rooms are dark and small. AC was not working properly and check-in and check-out procedure was kind of chaotic. There was a lion living in the compound the following morning and as per the employees, that happens quite a lot. The lion was just lying on the second floor in front of two doors. Kind of scary but as I said, you are right in the middle of everything!
reviews.title: Faded glory

reviews.text: This lodge is beautiful with very good views of the area. However, the rooms although very clean, are in an avarage condition with very noisy wood floors and the running water on the bathroom was so weak that was very difficult to take a shower. I reported it to the front desk and it was not fixed. Anyways, the food was the best from all the lodges that I stayed during my safari.. As most places around this area, the power and hot water are cut off at 12 PM to about 5:30 AM. There is not internet despite of what they claim and like somebody else mentioned, the fitness center has brand new machines but is not open for some unknown reason.
reviews.title: It is OK..

reviews.text: My dad, husband and I stayed at this lodge during our safari in the Serengeti for 1 night. This is a beautiful lodge built between large rocks situated on a small hill in the middle of the Serengeti. It is beautiful and offers great views of the area. There are monkey's and baboons that wander around the lookout area which adds to the atmosphere. There is a beautiful pool, a nice bar/lounge and great buffet restaurant with good food. The floors in the room are a little loud and "creaky" and the mattress a little hard, otherwise a great place to stay!
reviews.title: Beautiful lodge in the middle of the Serengeti

reviews.text: This lodge has an incredible look to it as the main building is built into and around giant granite boulders. They are literally inside and outside the building as some may reach 30 feet tall. The overlook is amazing where you can see a large water hole with hippos sounding off all night. The rooms have extremely loud squeaky wood floors. As most places are, the power and hot water are cut off at midnight and come back at 5am. The rooms are average on space and the food is good. There is a weight room with exercise equipment that has looked like it is ready to open for the last year, but for some reason they have not yet opened it. One key thing is that you HAVE to know where the migration is located for the time that you want to book. This makes a big diference in the price as well as how far in advance you have to make your reservations. I highly recommend Fortes Car Hire out of Mwanza for any Safari needs. I have the names, numbers and email for them if you need any further info. You can contact me at rfrasier@cornerstonenashville.org if you need any additional info on them.
reviews.title: decent lodge with good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Seronera wildlife lodge for 2 nights while we were on safari.
reviews.title: no mosquito net for the bed yet mosquitoes buzzing around at night

reviews.text: This place has an amazing location and so much potential, but if fails to deliver.
reviews.title: Really disappointing

reviews.text: We stayed here two nights with our other safari nigths in tents.. the tent option was far better!! The place may have been great in about 1982, but the furnishing and fixtures haven't been attended to since. The first night we had a power black out - something one can expect when staying remote.. but the staff were rude and unhelpful in dealing with the situation. The candlight also added ambiance (a good thing) which in the morning (with the light) revealed filthy stained furnishings and i believe the same food recycled into the next meal.
reviews.title: Good stay

reviews.text: Some other things that this place has / doesn't have include:
reviews.title: fine for one night of a safari but wouldn't stay here for longer.

reviews.text: _rock hard beds
reviews.title: Seronera Wildlife Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: _a locked unusable gym
reviews.title: Fantastic location but service could be much better.

reviews.text: This place was OK. ( Its sister hotel at Ngorongo Crater was fabulous) Our room was a long walk, with stairs to the lobby and restaurant. I was with 2 people who could not maneuver alot of stairs so it was a problem. Rooms were fine...food was OK. Gorgeous view. Fitness center wasnt open. Internet cafe not open. No internet available.
reviews.title: Not suitable for the handicapped or elderly

reviews.text: Spectacular surrounding this lodge is situated around huge rock outcrops with paintings on them. The pool area has a viewing deck which overlooks the plains below where hot air balloons take off into the sky. Loads of dassies running around and great sunset having a cold drink made it a wonderful experience. Service good food not bad rooms adequate for a one night stay all you need on safari is a place to sleep after a day on bad roads chasing the Big Cats. The setting certainly blows you away and the live music during dinner was pleasant. Lovely would stay there again
reviews.title: Serrengetti Safari July 2012

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights while on safari visiting the Serengeti, Ngorongoro Crater, and Lake Manyara. We came into the lodge grounds around 8 or 9pm when it was dark but all the lights high atop the grounds where the lodge is situated were splendid and inviting-- an oasis of sorts! Check-in was easy (12 of us plus 2 guides). Rooms had a very African feel. Hot showers except for certain times in the day/night (we were informed of this upon check-in). Very clean. Squeaky floors, but that's quite a minor complaint. Food was absolutely fantastic with a huge selection (buffet style). A tremendous bar/sitting area on the higher level with fantastic views. The lookout deck provides an amazing morning and evening view over the Serengeti. Didn't have time to use the pool (also wasn't overly warm weather during my stay), but it looked spectacular (although a bit small). Small animals roaming around the premises (hyrax and many monkeys) and also larger animals (giraffes, hippos) around the grounds-- feet away from your bedroom window!! Overall, during my 2 visits in TZ and second safari, this was by far the best place I have stayed. HIGHLY recommended.
reviews.title: Worth every penny-- amazing!

reviews.text: Cons:
reviews.title: A+ Location Z- Service

reviews.text: No internet access
reviews.title: Luxury in Wild !

aka: Seronera Wildlife Hotel Serengeti National Park
description: Seronera Wildlife Lodge is artfully constructed round a rocky outcrop from glass and wood elements, perfectly blending into its surrounding; next to the lodge, several waterholes attract day and night the most amazing animals, providing a unique opportunity for a close encounter with the so called Big Five. The Lodge is only 5 minutes far from the departing point of the hot - air balloon safaris, which offer a thrilling birds-eye wildlife perspective of the vast plains of the Serengeti.
